As an AI language model, I don't have personal experiences but here are the general steps for designing a mobile application for e-commerce businesses:

1. Define your target market and objectives: Know your target customer base and their behavior. Set achievable goals and work towards them.

2. Do competitor research: Identify the competition and what they are doing well. Analyze their strengths and weaknesses and look for gaps in the market.

3. Choose your platform and technology stack: Decide the platform you'll be designing the app for and the technology stack that will support it.

4. Create a wireframe and prototype: Create a blueprint of the app and a prototype to test user experience.

5. Focus on user experience and user interface: Design an intuitive user interface and a smooth user experience. User interface should be appealing, easy to use, and navigation should be seamless.

6. Develop an MVP: Build an MVP (minimum viable product) to test the app's functionality and look for areas of improvement.

7. Conduct testing and feedback: Employ usability testing to gain more general feedback and ideas from the users.

8. Develop the final product: Use feedback and insights to make changes to the MVP and develop the final product.

9. Launch and maintain the app: Launch the app and promote it through different marketing channels. Regularly maintain and update the application to keep it relevant and successful.

10. Monitor performance and make enhancements: Track the performance of the app and continue to enhance and make improvements to it to meet the needs of your customers.
